title: Apple Inc. stock underperforms Monday when compared to competitors
text:
Shares of Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -1.06%
       dropped 0.36% to $191.73 Monday, on what proved to be an all-around positive trading session for the stock market, with the NASDAQ Composite Index 
        COMP,
        -0.12%
       rising 1.12% to 15,628.04 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       rising 0.59% to 38,333.45. This was the stock's fourth consecutive day of losses. Apple Inc. closed $7.89 short of its 52-week high ($199.62), which the company reached on December 14th. The stock underperformed when compared to some of its competitors Monday, as Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       rose 1.43% to $409.72, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.21%
       rose 0.68% to $154.84, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       rose 0.87% to $153.51. Trading volume (46.8 M) remained 5.9 million below its 50-day average volume of 52.6 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. The stock looks like a bet on Trump himself more than a company with significant revenue and profits.
